activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard P. Guski Jr.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity: Preliminary hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Clerk

9:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard P. Guski Jr. in court in person.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier in court in person for Richard P. Guski Jr. Witness's are sequestered. Deputy Cole Walsh of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken in person. Deputy Jeffrey Adams of Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken in person; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, court enters a not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Richard P. Guski not in court.  Alexander David Goulart appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendants attorney unavailable. Court finds good cause to continue, waiving time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:45 PM Defendant Richard P. Guski not in court. Alexander David Goulart appeared in person in courtroom for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Goulart states attorney Freier is requesting preliminary hearing to be rescheduled and in person and is in agreement. Bond to continue. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court Appointed Attorney Payment Information

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:45 AM Defendant Richard P. Guski in court in person and with attorney Joseph Michael Freier by video means.  Alexander David Goulart appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Preliminary hearing requested, in person, time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity:Indigency Hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:35 PM Defendant Richard P. Guski in court by video, in custody.  Noah M Tylenda appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds defendant indigent. Court appoints attorney Freier. Defendant to pay $50.00 per month reimbursement.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard P. Guski Jr.

03:04 PM Defendant Richard P. Guski in court, in custody by video from the Rock County Jail.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter remanded to Branch 6 for appointment of counsel.

Activity: adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:55 PM  Defendant Richard P. Guski in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Kevin M Smith also appearing by video.  Cheniqua White   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued to allow defendant additional time to have attorney appointed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Mary Elizabeth Bricco  and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
